programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.sub-title: "In a Camp Down by the River"
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Kampar River in Sumatra, Indonesia boasts the world’s longest wave: a cyclical tidal bore known as “Bono Seven Ghosts” that can run over 13 miles long and be surfed for an hour-and-a-half. This Rivers are Life adventure film explores the relationship between the Kampar River and its surrounding communities, focusing on how surfing has strengthened this connection.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, the Friends of the Fox River (FOTFR) organization has been working to protect and restore the Fox River in Illinois and Wisconsin. Now led by Gary Swick and Jenni Kempf, FOTFR is still fighting for the Fox, organizing river cleanup events to remove tons of trash from the river basin and educating students by bringing them directly to the watershed.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: In this milestone episode of Modern Hunter, Tinsae Rucks takes a major step forward in his hunting journey.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen? - Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.sub-title: "Islamorada Blackfins And Mahis With Capt Scott Stoky"
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve start the season with Capt. Scott Stoky chasing Islamorada Tunas and Mahis offshore out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve catch a mixed bag bottom fishing off of Islamorada with Captain Scott Stoky.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve go yellow tailing out of Hawks Cay for a limit of tasty yellowtail snapper and Steve picks a battle with a big lemon shark.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve bounce around the reefs out of Hawks Cay catching a wide variety of reef dwellers.

programme.title: TRP
programme.sub-title: "Captain Harley Hunt's Beginner Guide to Boating! ⎸ H2T Ep. #924"
programme.desc: Last week we had the incredible Harley Hunt from How To Boating on the full length Tom Rowland Podcast. This week we have him back to share his tips to every new boater. - Watch now to enhance your skills and improve your fishing game! Don't forget to subscribe for more practical fishing tips and tutorials. - Check out how this test compares to all the others I have done; get your FREE Knot Guide here! — - https://bit.ly/3UnAeIP - All Socials ⎯ - https://linktr.ee/TomRowlandPodcast - How2Tuesday is presented by Danco Pliers! - Danco Sports is an industry-leading manufacturer of pliers, knives, and accessories for anglers worldwide. Since our start in 2006, we have been committed to providing affordable, high-quality products and outstanding customer service to anglers and fishing leaders alike. Danco Pliers is located in Stuart, Florida, where we wear flip-flops to work year-round. - Check out Danco here — - https://bit.ly/tomrowlandpodcast2

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools weren’t set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 3 has the BaitFuel Fishing Tour Teams Cornwall, Ontario for a back to back on Lake St. Francis.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The final qualifier takes place out of Cardinal, Ontario on the mighty St. Lawrence River.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to a new body of water in search of Largemouth and Smallmouth Bass right after a major front blew through the area.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP & Todd Currie head down to the Niagara River to target Steelhead and Brown Trout.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Louisiana's Wild Food & Award-Winning Cuisine | Hog Hunting, Swamp Fishing & MORE"
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Can You Surf & Eat Like a Local in Minnesota? Wild Foraging & Delicious Local Eats"
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring New York City's Hidden Culinary Gems: Cooking Goat Brains, Lobster & MORE"
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Alaskan Fishing, Foraging, & Mountainside Cooking with Local Legends"
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins marketing genius & super talented photographer Dylan Schmitz for a day in Islamorada.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Jared's long time friend and fellow guide, Greg Dini, joins Jared for a day in the backcountry.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Jared teams up with his long time friend Capt. Randy Stallings to pull off the elusive “Super Slam”.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Motorcycle junkie and Army veteran Dave Allen recounts the terrifying prospect of facing chemical warfare during Operation Desert Storm with host Jay Garstecki and special guest Paul Sr. from American Choppers.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Shot through the neck on Fort Hood in Texas, Green Beret John Arroyo recounts coming face to face with his attacker and Jesus blinding his would be killer.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Ginger Gilbert-Ravella honors the memory her husband…American hero Troy Gilbert.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take their brand new Invincible 36’ out of Plantation Boat Mart to fly the kites for some early season sailfishing.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36’ into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Julie Higgs Spearfishing
programme.desc: In the series premiere, Julie embarks on an exhilarating journey to Costa Rica alongside two enthusiastic friends. Determined to land a monster first yellowfin tuna, Julie pushes her limits—not only guiding her friends to hook their inaugural catch, but also aiming to surpass her personal best: a remarkable 180-pound yellowfin.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Brandon fishes with Robbie Crosnoe On Lake Henderson. These longtime buddies are dialed into the lake like no one else.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Capt. Brandon Branch, Steve Grant and Kelly Player leave Jacksonville, FL for the Gulfstream to get into some Mahi.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week, we reflect on a tragic and sad memory in our lives as we remember a dear childhood friend of my son Nick, Nathan Wimsatt. Our families have been close for man years and shared a lot of time together around the soccer field, vacations, fishing trips, and much more. Nathan passed in a tragic car accident at only 18 years on April 29th, 2023. This week his Dad Brian is joining me on Lake Taylorsville where we'll share some memories and celebrate Nathan's life...that ended way to soon!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Sheila Mitchell-Murphy honors the memory her Son…American hero Etienne Murphy.
